questions.question: Which is not a logical protection method?
Which is not a physical protection method?
Which example is a loss of Intellectual Property?
options: Designs for a new prototype could be stolen and copied or deleted
Failing to meet moral and legal obligations and losing personal data
Attacking a business’ servers will impact that business as well as any third parties
A direct physical threat to a country or a threat to the financial security of the state
questions.correct_answer: Designs for a new prototype could be stolen and copied or deleted

questions.question: Which is a principle of information security (CIA Triad)?
Which is not in a data flow diagram?
Which is not a rule in DFDs (Data Flow Diagrams)?
options: Every data flow connects to at least one process
Data flows only in one direction
Every data flow must go to or from a data store
questions.correct_answer: Every data flow must go to or from a data store

questions.question: What does RIPA stand for?
What legislation provides the public with the right to access information about activities carried out by public authorities.
What is greenwashing?
options: Someone (typically a company) pretending to be greener than they actually are
A method of cleaning computer hardware using eco-friendly products.
An online scam where fake environmental charities ask for donations.
A technique for recycling old computer components into new ones.
questions.correct_answer: Someone (typically a company) pretending to be greener than they actually are

questions.question: How could a company implement green computing?
options: Using energy star labelled products - energy efficiency rating
Only using computers at night when electricity is cheaper
Disabling all security features to make devices run faster
Installing more RGB lighting to brighten up the workspace
questions.correct_answer: Using energy star labelled products - energy efficiency rating

questions.question: Which is not a stage of data analysis?
What does GIS stand for?
What would a customers address be classified as?
Which is not a characteristic of good quality information?
Identify the Act that requires internet service providers to keep a log of their customers’ use.
Which best describes primary data?
options: Information collected firsthand by the researcher for their specific research question
Information that has been generated from within a business through its operations
Information that has already been collected by someone else for a different purpose
Information gathered from websites, books, or reports written by others
questions.correct_answer: Information collected firsthand by the researcher for their specific research question

questions.question: What's one advantage of a business using separate tables for customers and staff?
options: Access to each table can be different for different roles
The amount of duplicate data stored may increase
It makes the database load slower
Customers and staff can be contacted using the same contact details
questions.correct_answer: Access to each table can be different for different roles

questions.question: Which is an example of quantitative data?
options: Observations about customer behaviour in a shop

questions.question: Which is an example of qualitative data?
options: Time spent browsing the comapany website

questions.question: Identify the ICO code of practice that relates to how customers' data can be used between organisations.
Which best describes 'Integrity'?
options: Data is up to date, accurate and fit for purpose
Information is always accessible to those who require it
Information is only accessible by authorised users
Information is stored in a secure location to prevent unauthorized access
questions.correct_answer: Data is up to date, accurate and fit for purpose

questions.question: Identify the type of information storage media in which a memory stick would be included.
What best describes a closed system?
options: A system available to only certain people, with restricted access and no access to the public internet.
A system available to all people, with restricted access and no access to the public internet.
A system available to only certain people, with full access to the public internet.
A system available to all people, with full access to the public internet.
questions.correct_answer: A system available to only certain people, with restricted access and no access to the public internet.

questions.question: Which is a characteristic of an intranet?
Which of these is not a category of information holder?
Which type of internet connection would be most reliable in a warzone?
Which of the these is an advantage of using paper?
Which of these is classified as a shared device?
Which one of these networks allow password protected connections from outside an organisation?
What does latency mean?
What's the advantage of copper over fibre?
Which of these don't require line of sight?
What inforamtion format is most suitable for an online diary?
How would you describe medical data that could be embarrassing?
What is a characteristic of data?
What is an advantage of open information systems?
options: Can interact with other information systems
questions.correct_answer: Can interact with other information systems

questions.question: What is big data?
options: Any data too large for traditional data analysis techniques
Data used for making important decisions
Anything written in a large font
Data used by the Business Information Group in your organisation
questions.correct_answer: Any data too large for traditional data analysis techniques

questions.question: Which process involves keeping data safe in line with laws such as the DPA and GDPR?
Which stage involves reviewing data to help make informed decisions?
Which stage is about sending the data elsewhere, such as to other systems or people?
What is the main focus of the 'Impact of Information on Stakeholders'?
options: Ensuring only authorised people can access data
Understanding how information affects the people involved
Collecting large volumes of customer data
questions.correct_answer: Understanding how information affects the people involved

questions.question: What is the role of the EDPB and which countries are members?
options: It enforces copyright laws across the EU and includes only EU member states
It manages data privacy for companies globally and includes all UN members
It ensures consistent application of GDPR and law enforcement data protection across the EEA
It creates new cybersecurity laws for all European countries including the UK
questions.correct_answer: It ensures consistent application of GDPR and law enforcement data protection across the EEA

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Identify the Need' stage in a data analysis project?
options: To choose the right software tools to visualise the data
To find out what needs to be learned and what information is required
To compare the data with historical trends
To record all findings and store them for future use
questions.correct_answer: To find out what needs to be learned and what information is required

questions.question: What does the 'Define Scope' stage focus on?
options: Setting limits like budget and deadlines for the project
Recording the results and storing them securely
Choosing suitable interview questions for participants
questions.correct_answer: Setting limits like budget and deadlines for the project

questions.question: What is the main goal of the 'Source and Select Information' stage?
options: To present data using visual tools like charts and graphs
To record final results and publish them for stakeholders
To gather and filter out unsuitable or biased information
To define project deadlines and budget restrictions
questions.correct_answer: To gather and filter out unsuitable or biased information

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of the internet for individuals?
What is a disadvantage of the internet for organisations?
Which is an advantage of the internet for organisations?
options: Cost of maintaining websites and data stores
Share large amounts of information quickly between countries
questions.correct_answer: Share large amounts of information quickly between countries

questions.question: Which of the following is classed as a handheld device?
Which device is an example of a shared device?
What type of device is a games console typically classed as?
What is the purpose of a firewall in a network?
options: To prevent malicious or unauthorised access
To send data packets across networks
questions.correct_answer: To prevent malicious or unauthorised access

questions.question: What does a router do in a network?
options: Shifts data packets from one network to another
questions.correct_answer: Shifts data packets from one network to another

questions.question: Which of the following best describes 'Ping of Death'?
options: A type of malware that steals data
A denial-of-service attack that overwhelms a server with requests
A tool used to test internet speed
questions.correct_answer: A denial-of-service attack that overwhelms a server with requests

questions.question: Which term refers to the competition for resources on a shared network connection?
What is latency in a network connection?
options: The amount of data that can be transferred at once
The time it takes for data to travel between devices
The maximum distance a connection can maintain
questions.correct_answer: The time it takes for data to travel between devices

questions.question: Which of the following is true about range in a network connection?
options: Measured in dB for wireless connections
Longer range offers less flexibility in device placement
Measured in meters or kilometers for wireless connections
Higher range reduces the signal quality
questions.correct_answer: Measured in meters or kilometers for wireless connections
